moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6
comment: Petrov's Defense

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6
comment: There are at least five good moves on Black's sixth turn. This is the most common these days. It controls square e5 and perhaps prepares ...Bc8-g4 and in some cases aims at Bd3 (via ...Nb4) to fight for control of light squares.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7
comment: By closing the e-file Black makes it easier to support Ne4, so White has to do more to undermine it.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O
comment: The center appears to be opening quickly, so it's only safe to move the king away from the e-file. Neither White nor Black was threatening anything significant just yet, so this was a good moment to ensure the king's safety.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3
comment: Now White threatens 11. cxd5 which forces Ne4 to be exchanged by 11...Nxc3 12. bxc3. Then Nb4 would be threatened and c3-c4 to secure Pd5 requires 12...Nxd5. Nd5 is less appealing than Qd5 or to have an empty square. All this forces Black to resecure Ne4 or to retreat it: both have been tried.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5
comment: After this Black might retreat ...Ne4-f6 and play ...Nb4-c2 to gain a quick draw by repetition by threatening White's Ra1. White has to do more to challenge the light squares, so cxd5 or a2-a3 are candidate moves.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6
comment: This is the best retreat White could force. Pd4 opposes Nc6, restraining it.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4
comment: Black's need to maneuver pieces forces him to allow White's bishop onto the a2-g8 diagonal, controlling d5!

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5
comment: In this direct attack on Pf7 White also controls e4 and fights for control of light squares everywhere.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7
comment: Karpov has always been a great defender and here he uses his queen rather than weaken his king's position with a pawn move.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4
comment: over-protecting Ng5 to renew the threat of h4-h5xg6

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3
comment: The knight had to retreat, but keep your eyes open, there's a new threat: Qxg6!

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3 Qf6 22. Re1 Bf5 23. Qf3 Kf8 24. Nf4 Bd7 25. g3
comment: White controls the light squares fairly well, but he hasn't been able to make any severe dents in Black's position. By defending both Nf4 & Ph4 he's probably preparing to move Qf3, though I'm not sure where he would need it most, perhaps Qf3-d5-b5.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3 Qf6 22. Re1 Bf5 23. Qf3 Kf8 24. Nf4 Bd7 25. g3 Re8 26. Rxe8+ Bxe8 27. Qe4 g5 28. hxg5 Qxg5 29. Bd5 Bd7 30. Qh7 Qf6 31. Bxf7
comment: This is the surprising impossible move which can in fact be played.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3 Qf6 22. Re1 Bf5 23. Qf3 Kf8 24. Nf4 Bd7 25. g3 Re8 26. Rxe8+ Bxe8 27. Qe4 g5 28. hxg5 Qxg5 29. Bd5 Bd7 30. Qh7 Qf6 31. Bxf7 Ne7 32. Bb3 Bf5 33. Nh5 Bxh7 34. Nxf6 Bg6
comment: So, they play an endgame with Anand having an extra pawn.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3 Qf6 22. Re1 Bf5 23. Qf3 Kf8 24. Nf4 Bd7 25. g3 Re8 26. Rxe8+ Bxe8 27. Qe4 g5 28. hxg5 Qxg5 29. Bd5 Bd7 30. Qh7 Qf6 31. Bxf7 Ne7 32. Bb3 Bf5 33. Nh5 Bxh7 34. Nxf6 Bg6 35. Ng4 Kg7 36. Ne3
comment: Ne3 opposes Ne7 and creates a neat perimeter from the a-file to the h-file.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3 Qf6 22. Re1 Bf5 23. Qf3 Kf8 24. Nf4 Bd7 25. g3 Re8 26. Rxe8+ Bxe8 27. Qe4 g5 28. hxg5 Qxg5 29. Bd5 Bd7 30. Qh7 Qf6 31. Bxf7 Ne7 32. Bb3 Bf5 33. Nh5 Bxh7 34. Nxf6 Bg6 35. Ng4 Kg7 36. Ne3 Be4 37. g4 Kf6 38. Kh2 b6 39. Kg3 Kg5 40. Bf7
comment: preparing Ne3-c4 to threaten Pd6

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3 Qf6 22. Re1 Bf5 23. Qf3 Kf8 24. Nf4 Bd7 25. g3 Re8 26. Rxe8+ Bxe8 27. Qe4 g5 28. hxg5 Qxg5 29. Bd5 Bd7 30. Qh7 Qf6 31. Bxf7 Ne7 32. Bb3 Bf5 33. Nh5 Bxh7 34. Nxf6 Bg6 35. Ng4 Kg7 36. Ne3 Be4 37. g4 Kf6 38. Kh2 b6 39. Kg3 Kg5 40. Bf7 Kf6 41. Bc4 Kg5 42. Bb3 Kf6 43. f3 Bg6 44. f4 Be4 45. Bc4
comment: White clearly isn't in any hurry and is thinking through his options.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3 Qf6 22. Re1 Bf5 23. Qf3 Kf8 24. Nf4 Bd7 25. g3 Re8 26. Rxe8+ Bxe8 27. Qe4 g5 28. hxg5 Qxg5 29. Bd5 Bd7 30. Qh7 Qf6 31. Bxf7 Ne7 32. Bb3 Bf5 33. Nh5 Bxh7 34. Nxf6 Bg6 35. Ng4 Kg7 36. Ne3 Be4 37. g4 Kf6 38. Kh2 b6 39. Kg3 Kg5 40. Bf7 Kf6 41. Bc4 Kg5 42. Bb3 Kf6 43. f3 Bg6 44. f4 Be4 45. Bc4 Bc6 46. Bd3 Bb7 47. Kh4 Bf3 48. Nc4 Nd5 49. Kg3 Bd1 50. Nxd6 Nxc3 51. Nf5 Kg6 52. d5
comment: It's time for Black to resign. He can't touch Pd5 because of Nf5-e3+, picking up Bd1, so Pd5 will continue advancing!

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d4 d5 6. Bd3 Nc6 7. O-O Be7 8. c4 Nb4 9. Be2 O-O 10. Nc3 Bf5 11. a3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 Nc6 13. Re1 Re8 14. Bf4 dxc4 15. Bxc4 Bd6 16. Rxe8+ Qxe8 17. Ng5 Bg6 18. Bxd6 cxd6 19. h4 Qe7 20. Qg4 h6 21. Nh3 Qf6 22. Re1 Bf5 23. Qf3 Kf8 24. Nf4 Bd7 25. g3 Re8 26. Rxe8+ Bxe8 27. Qe4 g5 28. hxg5 Qxg5 29. Bd5 Bd7 30. Qh7 Qf6 31. Bxf7 Ne7 32. Bb3 Bf5 33. Nh5 Bxh7 34. Nxf6 Bg6 35. Ng4 Kg7 36. Ne3 Be4 37. g4 Kf6 38. Kh2 b6 39. Kg3 Kg5 40. Bf7 Kf6 41. Bc4 Kg5 42. Bb3 Kf6 43. f3 Bg6 44. f4 Be4 45. Bc4 Bc6 46. Bd3 Bb7 47. Kh4 Bf3 48. Nc4 Nd5 49. Kg3 Bd1 50. Nxd6 Nxc3 51. Nf5 Kg6 52. d5 Ba4 53. d6 Bd7 54. Kh4
comment: Bd3 and Nf5 do a neat job of tying-up Nc3 and this just moves off a square where the knight might (!) have a chance to check. White is lining up all his ducks for the final breakthrough at d7.
